item.title: PS2 Games That Have Aged Like Fine Wine
item.description:
Summary

  • Many PS2 classics like Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas have aged well thanks to their engaging gameplay and vast content.
  • Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time still stands out due to its unique time-rewinding mechanics and timeless story.
  • Shadow of the Colossus remains a work of art with minimalistic, boss-focused gameplay that has aged perfectly.

It’s mind-blowing to think that the PlayStation 2 is already over 25 years old, and yet it is still considered one of the best video game consoles ever made, in part due to its extensive and diverse catalog of high-quality titles. Of course, many of these games have aged quite poorly, and many others have aged just fine, but a fair share of them have aged masterfully.

Some of the best and most popular games on this sixth-generation system have stood the test of time and, even though they were released over two decades ago, can still be perfectly enjoyed to this day with little to no additions or changes. The following PS2 video games have aged like fine wine, and gamers who haven’t tried them out yet should go out of their way to do so.

Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas

An Expansive Open-World Game With A Lot Of Content

Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
112
8.6 /10
Released
October 26, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Thanks to the release of Rockstar’s Grand Theft Auto 3 , open-world sandbox games became extremely popular during the early 2000s. However, while that original title and its follow-up, GTA: Vice City , are undeniable classics of the genre, they haven’t aged particularly well in terms of story, scope, and content. Nevertheless, the same can’t be said about the third and final game in the franchise that was released on the PS2, Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas .

In a way, it feels like San Andreas has paved the way for the HD GTA games that came after it, because it tells a cinematic and engaging story set in a vibrant city called Los Santos that’s filled to the brim with stuff for the player to do, whether they decide to follow the narrative or just want to roam around freely to their hearts’ content. San Andreas even has a hidden local co-op mode, nine years before GTA Online was even a thing. This game was definitely ahead of its time, which is why it can still be enjoyed by fans of the open-world genre today.

Prince Of Persia: The Sands Of Time

Its Time-Rewinding Mechanic Is Still Unmatched

Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
9.2 /10
Released
October 28, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Teen // Blood, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

In the early 2000s, Ubisoft completely revitalized its Prince of Persia IP with the release of Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time , an incredible action-adventure title with a time-rewinding mechanic that felt extremely unique and innovative at the time: by using the titular Sands of Time, the player can rewind time for a few seconds, which is cleverly implemented in both the combat and the platforming.

But that’s not all, because Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time also tells a simple but fascinating, timeless story filled with witty comedic dialogue that still holds up surprisingly well. Furthermore, the climbing mechanics of this game are particularly entertaining, and they directly inspired the climbing in the Assassin’s Creed franchise. Ubisoft has been struggling to remake The Sands of Time since 2020, most likely because it’s almost impossible to change and/or fix a project that was already perfect from the get-go.

Shadow Of The Colossus

A Work Of Art That Was Ahead Of Its Time

Shadow of the Colossus
8.3 /10
Released
October 18, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood, Fantasy Violence
Powered by

Shadow of the Colossus is considered one of the best video games ever made, and one of the most solid examples of gaming as an art form. While Team ICO’s magnum opus has always been praised for its incredible graphics, beautiful soundtrack, and awe-inspiring boss fights, it was also criticized for its empty and barren open world.

Back in the day, a minimalistic home console action-adventure title that focused solely on bosses, with little to no content in between, was seen as weird and boring. But this is the one aspect of Shadow of the Colossus that has aged the best, seeing as there are so many minimalistic and artistic modern games on the market nowadays, both from AAA and indie studios. Needless to say, Shadow of the Colossus has aged so perfectly that both its PS3 remaster and PS4 remake have changed almost nothing about it.

Persona 4

The Best Turn-Based JRPG On The Console

Persona 4
9.3 /10
Released
July 10, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Alcohol Reference, Animated Blood, Language, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Violence
Powered by

Way before Persona 5 took the entire world by storm in 2017, Atlus had already proved that it could single-handedly revitalize the turn-based JRPG genre (which was seeing a decline in popularity during the mid-to-late 2000s) with the release of Persona 4 . It shouldn’t be a surprise that this PS2 game was so ahead of its time, seeing as it came out in 2008, almost two years after the PS3 had already launched.

Persona 4 stood out at the time because of its stylish presentation, its fast-paced turn-based combat, and its unique story with memorable characters, not to mention that it felt more accessible than previous entries in the series. The Persona IP wouldn’t be what it is today if it weren’t for its legendary fourth entry, and while Atlus has already confirmed that a remake (titled Persona 4 Revival ) is in production, the original PS2 version can still be enjoyed today with no problems.

Kingdom Hearts 2

A Colorful Disney Adventure With Fast-Paced Combat

Kingdom Hearts 2
Action RPG
Hack and Slash
Systems
Released
March 28, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Mild Blood, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Powered by

2002’s Kingdom Hearts made a huge impact on the entire gaming industry, as nobody expected this action RPG collaboration between Disney and Square Enix to be so good. But, while that original game is still considered a masterpiece, it also feels more like a product of its time, with slow combat, clunky platforming, small levels, and a restrictive camera angle. Nevertheless, three years later, Square Enix released Kingdom Hearts 2 , which is a much more timeless experience.

This game has one of the best combat systems of any action RPG, as it feels fun and simple at the beginning, but it ends up becoming surprisingly deep and complex by the end, especially when facing its incredible and challenging late-game bosses. Not even the combat in subsequent games in the same series, like Birth by Sleep or Kingdom Hearts 3 , could compete with this one. Another noteworthy aspect of Kingdom Hearts 2 that has aged extremely well is its presentation, as it has a colorful and cartoony art style with 3D models of both original anime-like characters and classic Disney icons that still look wonderful to this day.

Okami

A Painting Brought To Life, With A Unique Gameplay Hook

Okami
8.3 /10
Released
September 19, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Blood and Gore, Crude Humor, Fantasy Violence, Partial Nudity, Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco
Powered by

It’s evident that PS2 games with colorful presentations have aged significantly better than titles that tried to be as hyperrealistic as possible, and Okami is a perfect example of this occurrence. Curiously enough, Clover Studio was originally going to implement a more realistic art style for this game, but it eventually ditched it in favor of the beautiful and colorful art style based on traditional Japanese ink-based paintings that helped this game become the cult classic it is today.

Of course, Okami looks and sounds incredible, but its timeless presentation is not the only reason this action-adventure title has aged so particularly well. Its core gameplay, which is heavily inspired by The Legend of Zelda series, is incredibly engaging and entertaining, not to mention that its iconic Celestial Brush mechanic – which allows players to summon items and special powers by drawing shapes with Amaterasu’s ink – still feels like a breath of fresh air to this day, and no other AAA game has been able to replicate it.

Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater (Subsistence)

Still One Of The Best Video Games Ever Made

Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater (2004)
9.6 /10
Released
November 17, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language, Sexual Themes
Powered by

Hideo Kojima’s Metal Gear Solid series was doing extremely well during the late 90s and early 2000s, and it ultimately reached its highest peak in 2005, with the release of its third entry, Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater . For starters, since this game is technically a prequel, it’s incredibly accessible for newcomers to the series, although it rewards longtime fans who are familiar with its rich and complex lore.

Metal Gear Solid 3 has what’s possibly the deepest and most brilliant core gameplay in the entire stealth genre, as it’s filled with innovative mechanics that enhance the experience, multiple mind-blowing sequences that only Kojima could come up with, and some of the most creative boss battles ever created. The only aspect of Metal Gear Solid 3 that hasn’t aged particularly well is its fixed camera angles, which is why its revised version, Metal Gear Solid 3: Subsistence , completely ditched them in favor of a free third-person camera system that Kojima would reuse later in Metal Gear Solid 4. Konami’s upcoming 2025 remake, Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater , will try to change as few things from the original version as possible, which is solid proof of how timeless Snake Eater still is to this day.

Resident Evil 4

A Revolutionary Third-Person Shooter That Didn’t Even Need A Remake

Resident Evil 4
7 /10
24
9.3 /10
Released
January 11, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language
Powered by

When rumors of a hypothetical Resident Evil 4 remake hit the internet many years ago, fans naturally began questioning Capcom’s decision since, after all, this legendary third-person shooter from 2005 has aged like fine wine and can still be experienced on most modern systems. Fortunately, Resident Evil 4 Remake ended up absolutely amazing in every way, but it couldn’t even surpass the original, which is still being played by countless fans today.

Resident Evil 4 pretty much revitalized the third-person shooter genre and established mechanics that many other popular games, like Gears of War , Uncharted , or Dead Space , would go on to use many years later. While some people may dismiss the fact that Leon Kennedy can’t move while shooting as something that hasn’t aged well, this couldn’t be further from the truth, since this game was built entirely around that restriction. The shooting still feels incredibly satisfying, the enemies are still intimidating and ruthless, the disturbing atmosphere is still impeccable, the bleak environments and detailed character models still look amazing, and it’s filled to the brim with additional content that encourages multiple playthroughs. Resident Evil 4 is a masterpiece that is still worth checking out, regardless of its modern-day remake.

item.title: Warframe: Best Robotic Companions
item.description:
Like most MMOs, Warframe features a companion and pet system. However, what sets this system apart is that, while pets in many MMOs are primarily cosmetic, Warframe companions actively assist in combat, dealing damage to enemies and providing defensive support to players.

There are several categories or species of companions available, but robotic companions are some of the most diverse in Warframe . These range from floating sentinels that accompany players to robotic canines that offer unique advantages throughout both the early and late stages of the game.

Most Robotic companions require two companion slots, one for the companion itself, and one for its weapon.

Taxon

With You Since The Beginning

The Taxon sentinel is one of the first companions players will receive since it is tied to one of the initial activities in Warframe . To unlock it, players will need to complete the Venus Junction on Earth to get its blueprint.

One of the main advantages of the Taxon is its main mod, Molecular Conversion, which transforms damage dealt into shields for the player's Warframe . Taxon also comes equipped with its main weapon, the Artax, which deals cold damage, freezing and slowing enemies down for a better chance of survivability.

Nautilus

Part Of The Crew

The components for Nautilus can be acquired by completing Railjack missions, specifically in Neptune Proxima. It is also in Railjack nodes where this companion shines. Nautilus includes the mod Auto Omni, which helps the player with repairs and extinguish the fires inside the Railjack.

It also includes the Cordon mod, which pulls enemies into a specific area, perfect for repelling ship invaders. As its weapon, Nautilus has the Verglas, a weapon that fires a beam of cold and uses rifle mods. For both new and veteran players doing Railjack runs, this companion will be a great help.

Some Sentinels have a Prime or Prisma version in addition to their standard form.

Custom MOA

The Enemy Of My Enemy...

While ranking as one of the most frequent enemies of the Corpus faction, MOAs can also be companions. To build them, you will need to level up on the Venus faction, Solaris United. After leveling up and having enough standing, you can buy MOA parts and assemble them from the merchant, Legs.

To build a MOA players will need four main components: the Model, Core, Gyro and Bracket. Each component can be selected from a handful of parts. These parts have their own unique stats and mods; some include more offensive perks, while others offer additional health or shields. It is up to the players if they want to build a MOA for defense, offense or a hacking assistant.

Helios

A Scanner Best Friend

Corpus in design, Helios can be a great help both for new players and veterans. With its scan capabilities, it can assist players with codex scans. It can also highlight enemy weaknesses, for even veteran players who are having a hard time with high-level combatants.

Helios can be acquired from the Dojo in the Energy Lab section, as well as the Fieldron, one of the components necessary to build it. Helios comes equipped with its Deconstructor weapon, which works as a throwing melee weapon and uses melee mods as well.

Carrier

Unlimited Ammo

In looter shooters, ammo capacity is always an essential element to have at its best, and for Warframe this applies as well. With the Carrier companion, you won’t have to worry about ammo anymore, as it will convert ammo and will have extra ammo space thanks to its Ammo Case mod.

For survival and long missions, this companion is a must. With its Sweeper default weapon, which fires strong shotgun rounds, it will be a great companion for both early and late game content. The blueprint for Carrier can be acquired from the market for 100,000 credits.

Hounds

Bad, Good Boy...

Similar to MOAs, Hounds are created with the merchant Legs with four components, Model, Core, Bracket and Stabilizer. However, the method of obtaining their parts is probably the most difficult of all companions. You must vanquish Sisters of Parvos to obtain random Hound blueprints.

Each Hound also has their own unique weapon, the Lacerten, Batoten and Akaten, which do mainly Impact and Slash damage. Like the beast companions that need to be mature for combat, the Hounds need to be Gild to fully use their max potential. The process can be completed with Legs as well, if you have high enough standing with Solaris United.

Dethcube

The Lethal Companion

For players looking for the best offensive advantage, the Dethcube companion will help with eliminating enemies both at long and close range, as well as giving the player energy to continue any streak. The blueprints for the Dethcube can be purchased from the market.

The Dethcube comes with one of the most powerful companion weapons, the Deth Machine Rifle. This weapon deals high damage per second at long range. For close range, Dethcube has an additional attack with the Vaporize mod, a radiation laser beam, making it one of the most lethal companions in Warframe .

Djinn

Sentinel Of All Trades

A jack of all trades, Djinn is an infested sentinel companion that deals great damage, while also helping the player with defensive capabilities. Djinn can be acquired in the Dojo’s Bio Lab section.

Djinn’s Stinger weapon fires toxin darts, while the Fatal Attraction mod lures enemies closer to it and then attacks them with the Gazal Machete.

Djinn is also equipped with the Reawaken mod, which reduces its recovery time. If combined with the Sacrifice mod, it will sacrifice itself for its downed owner and recover quickly for battle. This mods combination makes Djinn the most reliable robotic companion in all Warframe .

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: How to Reach Shellwood in Hollow Knight: Silksong
item.description:
Hollow Knight: Silksong drops players into an enormous map, segmented by different areas that feature unique biomes and lore to go along with it. Shellwood is one of these areas that you'll visit towards the end of Act One of the game. However, players will need to progress through the Far Fields and deal with a tough boss fight in Greymoor to reach the area. Here's a complete guide to help you reach Shellwood and get a map of the area.

How to Reach Shellwood in Silksong

To reach Shellwood in Silksong , players will need to progress through the Far Fields and reach Greymoor. For players to use the air currents to exit Far Fields, they'll need to receive the Drifter's Cloak (Float ability) by completing the Flexile Spines quest .

Once they finally have the ability, head over to the main cavern of Far Fields (marked above) and ride the air currents up to the surface.

Once players enter Greymoor, they can acquire the map of the area by simply heading right from the entrance and purchasing it from Shakra. Once you finally have a map to know your way around Greymoor, keep heading left, past the Halfway Home inn. The entrance to the inn will be closed, so you'll have to climb your way over the building and reach the area beyond.

After making your way through tight caverns and fields of Crawbugs, you'll eventually reach an open area where you'll encounter Moorwing (boss) .

It's a rather tricky boss fight, but it's only after defeating the boss that you will be able to progress further west and enter the area of Haunted Bellhart . While players will need to complete a rather important quest here, they can skip this area for now and head further west.

After the cutscene concludes, you can simply run past all the strung-up bugs in Bellhart and progress further west until eventually you'll end up in Shellwood .

Where to Find the Map for Shellwood in Silksong?

Now that you've arrived at Shellwood in Silksong , it's time to get your hands on a map to make navigation easier. Keep heading further west, past the swamp and start climbing higher and higher to progress to the next area of Shellwood (doorway to the top-left).

You'll enter a dark cavern, and dropping to the lower platform will initiate an ambush of bugs that you'll need to take down.

Once all bugs are defeated, climb to the upper area and exit through the pathway on the left. You'll spot a cage elevator , which you can use to head to the lower section of the area. Once descended, you can stomp on the button to your right to open a shortcut back to the main area.

Keep heading left past the swamp and into the next area to the left. Here, you'll finally meet Shakra, who'll have the Bellhart and Shellwood map in her offerings . Now you'll be able to freely explore the lush green area of Shellwood, and can head back to Bellhart to lift the curse off its citizens in Silksong .

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: Roblox: Cookie Kingdom World Codes (September 2025)
item.description:
Cookie Kingdom World is a Roblox game with cute graphics where you play as a cute cookie. However, you will face a difficult fate, because you will have to get out of scary levels full of crumbles. You need to be quick-witted and have fast reflexes, because enemies will constantly be looking for you, while you have to launch machines to pass to the next level.

The game features a variety of characters with cool abilities and characteristics, as well as items that can make it easier to progress. However, beginners will have to play without them at first. Some things require a lot of spins, and some require game currency. Fortunately, you can get free rewards if you purchase Cookie Kingdom World .

All Cookie Kingdom World Codes

Working Cookie Kingdom World Codes

  • SUBTOHOPLAS - Redeem this code to get 3 Lucky Spins.
  • SUBTOCYBER - Redeem this code to get 3 Lucky Spins.
  • 2KLikes - Redeem this code to get 4 Spins.
  • JoinGroup - Redeem this code to get 5 Spins.
  • Release - Redeem this code to get 5 DoubleSpins.

Expired Cookie Kingdom World Codes

There are currently no expired codes in the game. All codes are working, and you can receive rewards for them.

How to Redeem Codes in Cookie Kingdom World

In Cookie Kingdom World , you can redeem codes just as easily as in many other Roblox games. To do this, simply find the appropriate button in the game interface while in the lobby. However, the process may be unclear to beginners, so we have created a guide explaining how to redeem codes in Cookie Kingdom World :

  • Launch Roblox and open Cookie Kingdom World .
  • Look at the left side of the screen. Find and click the Use Code button to open the code redemption window.
  • Next, paste the code for the list of working codes into the black field and click the gray Redeem button.

In many games, codes can expire quickly, so to get all the rewards, you need to redeem them as soon as possible.

How to Get More Cookie Kingdom World Codes

You can find all working Roblox codes in this guide. We update it regularly, so all the information in it is up to date. However, if you want information directly from the developers of Cookie Kingdom World , you can find the link below:

  • Cookie Kingdom World Roblox game page
  • Cookie Kingdom World Roblox group
  • Cookie Kingdom World Discord server
  • Cookie Kingdom World X page

item.title: Roblox: Popmart Store Simulator Codes (September 2025)
item.description:
Popmart Store Simulator is a Roblox game where you will manage your own store and serve customers. There are several games with similar gameplay and interfaces, but here, you will be selling Labubus, arguably the most popular collectible in the world right now. You will buy them, arrange them on the shelves, and, of course, sell them. When there are no customers, you can customize your Labubu, change its color, or dress it in cute outfits. You can also buy and arrange decorations for the store.

This will require a lot of money, but at the beginning of the game, you will constantly be short of it. You can spend a little Robux, but it is not really necessary. The developers of Popmart Store Simulator allow you to redeem codes and receive free rewards.

All Popmart Store Simulator Codes

Working Popmart Store Simulator Codes

  • FirstStep - Redeem this code to get $200.

Expired Popmart Store Simulator Codes

Currently, there are no expired codes for Popmart Store Simulator . All codes are working, and you can redeem them.

How to Redeem Codes in Popmart Store Simulator

Codes in Roblox games are easy to redeem, as it is a way to keep players in the game and give them something nice. Especially if you have already played games like Popmart Store Simulator , you should have no problems at all, as their interfaces are identical. Just go to the phone menu and press the Code button. However, if this is your first time playing a game like this, we can help you. Just use our guide explaining how to redeem Popmart Store Simulator codes:

  • Launch Roblox and open Popmart Store Simulator .
  • Go to the phone menu. On a PC, press the Z key. On a mobile device, simply tap the phone icon on the left side of the screen.
  • Next, click on the green Code button.
  • Paste the code from the list of working codes into the text field and click on the green Enter button.

Codes in Roblox games can quickly expire, so you need to redeem them as soon as possible to get rewards.

How to Get More Popmart Store Simulator Codes

We regularly update all our guides with codes so that they always contain up-to-date information. If you want to be among the first to receive rewards, bookmark this page in your browser so you don't lose it. But if you want to receive codes directly from the developers, follow the links below:

  • Popmart Store Simulator Roblox game page
  • Popmart Store Simulator Roblox group
